title: Arthritis An Introduction
content:
It involves a change to the protective cushion of the cartilage covering the ends of your bones, where two bones meet to form a joint.
Read more about[osteoarthritis](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/o/osteoarthritis "Osteoarthritis \(OA\)").
#### Rheumatoid arthritis
[](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/r/rheumatoid-arthritis "Rheumatoid Arthritis ")Rheumatoid arthritis can start at any age but usually occurs between the ages of 20 and 55. Three times as many women than men are affected. If not properly treated, ongoing inflammation can progressively damage your joints and cause joint deformities. Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune condition, so it can also affect other systems in your body.
Read more about[rheumatoid arthritis](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/r/rheumatoid-arthritis "Rheumatoid arthritis").
#### Gout arthritis
Gout causes sudden attacks of pain in some joints. It can affect any joint but the first attack usually affects your big toe or another part of your foot. The joint becomes painful and swollen and the skin over the joint can become red and shiny. If not treated, gout can become chronic, causing damage to your joints and bones.
Read more about[gout](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/g/gout "Gout ").
#### Other types of arthritis
Other types of arthritis include:
  * [knee arthritis](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/k/knee-arthritis "Knee arthritis")
  * [ankylosing spondylitis](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/a/ankylosing-spondylitis "Ankylosing spondylitis")
  * [juvenile idiopathic arthritis](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/a/arthritis-children) (arthritis in children)
  * [lupus or systemic lupus erythematosus ](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/l/lupus "Lupus")
  * [polymyalgia rheumatica](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/p/polymyalgia-rheumatica-pmr "Polymyalgia rheumatica \(PMR\)")
  * [psoriatic arthritis](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/p/psoriasis "Psoriasis")
  * [reactive arthritis](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/r/reactive-arthritis "Reactive arthritis")
  * [scleroderma](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/s/scleroderma "Scleroderma").


####  Who is at risk of getting arthritis? 
While anyone can be affected by arthritis at any stage of life, there are 5 groups most at risk:
  * **Overweight people**
  * **Older people**
  * **Sports people**
  * **Women**
  * **Mā****ori and Pasifika men** – Māori and Pasifika men in Aotearoa New Zealand have the highest rate of gout arthritis in the world.


Other risk factors include:
  * having a family history of arthritis
  * if you have had a joint injury or joint infection
  * having worked in heavy physical occupation.


#### Arthritis in children
Children can develop arthritis too.
